alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 22 at 8:29PM CST until February 22 at 9:15PM CST by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: The National Weather Service in North Platte has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... East central Lincoln County in southwestern Nebraska... * Until 915 PM CST. * At 826 PM CST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from Sutherland to 6 miles northeast of Dickens to near Wellfleet, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous and life-threatening travel conditions are expected to develop rapidly in the warning area. This includes Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 190 and 207. Locations impacted include... Brady, Maxwell, Vroman and Jeffrey Canyon State Wildlife Management Area. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED SNOW SQUALL IMPACT...SIGNIFICANT
